name: Thomas Kent Callen
summary: Computer Science engineer with experience in embedded systems, IoT hardware/software integration, and full-stack development. Skilled in building prototypes from concept to deployment, including Raspberry Pi/Pico-based sensor systems, cloud integration (Azure, AWS), and React frontends. Proven leadership in NASA-funded student design challenges and nonprofit engineering initiatives.

education.degree: Bachelor of Science in Engineering in Computer Science

coursework.title: Web Systems
coursework.description: Concepts surrounding web systems, applications, and internet scale distributed systems. Topics covered include client/server protocols, security, information retrieval and search engines, scalable data processing, and fault tolerant systems.

coursework.title: Mobile App Development for Entrepreneurs
coursework.description: Best practices in the software engineering of mobile applications and best practices of software entrepreneurs in the design, production and marketing of mobile apps. Engagement in the hands-on practice of entrepreneurship by actually inventing, building, and marketing a mobile app.

coursework.title: Election Security
coursework.description: This course will provide a deep examination of the past, present, and future of election mechanics, informed by perspectives from computer security, tech policy, human factors, and more. We'll cover vulnerabilities and safeguards for election infrastructure; the rise of election security disinformation; legal and regulatory structures that impact election security at federal, state, and local levels; and efforts to change technology and policy to strengthen security. Our weekly discussions will be informed by current events surrounding the 2024 presidential election.

coursework.title: Introduction to Computer Security
coursework.description: Introduction to the principles and practices of computer security as applied to software, host systems, and networks. Covers the foundations of building, using, and managing secure systems. Topics include standard cryptographic functions and protocols, threats and defenses for real-world systems, include response, and computer forensics.

coursework.title: Introduction to Quantum Computing
coursework.description: A practical approach towards exploring how each layer of the computing stack is impacted by quantum computing. Quantum logic design using classical oracles, phase kickback, and entanglement. Quantum algorithms including Deutsch-Jozsa, Grover's, and Shor's. Error correction schemes including Shor and Steane codes. Building fault-tolerant architectures.

coursework.title: Data Mining
coursework.description: Fundamental concepts and methods in data mining, and practical skills for mining massive, real data on distributed frameworks (e.g., Hadoop). Topics include big data systems, frequent itemsets, similarity and cluster analysis, classification, dimensionality reduction, mining of networks, time series and data streams, and applications (e.g., social network analysis, web search).

coursework.title: Foundations of Computer Science
coursework.description: An introduction to theory of computation. Models of computation: finite state machines, Turing machines. Decidable and undecidable problems. Polynomial time computability and paradigms of algorithm design. Computational complexity emphasizing NP-hardness. Coping with intractability. Exploiting intractability: cryptography.

coursework.title: Introduction to Computer Organization
coursework.description: Basic concepts of computer organization and hardware. Instructions executed by a processor and how to use these instructions in simple assembly-language programs. Stored-program concept. Data-path and control for multiple implementations of a processor. Performance evaluation, pipelining, caches, virtual memory, input/output.

coursework.title: Data Structures and Algorithms
coursework.description: Introduction to the algorithm analysis and O-notation; Fundamental data structures including lists, stacks, queues, priority queues, hash tables, binary trees, search trees, balanced, trees, and graphs; searching and sorting algorithms; recursive algorithms; basic graph algorithms; introduction to greedy algorithms and divide and conquer strategy. Several programming assignments.

coursework.title: Programming and Introductory Data Structures
coursework.description: Algorithm development and effective programming, top-down analysis, structured programming, testing, and program correctness. Program language syntax and static and runtime semantics. Scope, procedure instantiation, recursion, abstract data types, and parameter passing methods. Structured data types, pointers, linked data structures, stacks, queues, arrays, records, and trees.

coursework.title: Introduction to Logic Design
coursework.description: Boolean algebra, digital design techniques, logic gates, logic and state minimization, standard combinational circuits, latches and flip-flops, sequential circuits, synthesis of synchronous sequential circuits, state machines, FPGAs, memories, arithmetic circuits, and computer-aided design. Laboratory involves CAD-based design implemented on a FPGA including elementary interfacing.

coursework.title: Introduction to Signals and Systems
coursework.description: Theory and practice of signals and systems engineering in continuous and discrete time. Continuous-time linear time-invariant systems, impulse response, convolution. Fourier series, Fourier transforms, spectrum, frequency response and filtering. Sampling leading to basic digital signal processing using the discrete-time Fourier and the discrete Fourier transform. Laplace transform, transfer functions, poles and zeros, stability. Applications of Laplace transform theory to RLC circuit analysis. Introduction to communications, control, and signal processing.

coursework.title: Introduction to Electronic Circuits
coursework.description: Basic Concepts of voltage and current; Kirchhoff's voltage and current laws; Ohm's law; voltage and current sources; Thevenin and Norton equivalent circuits; DC and low frequency active circuits using operational amplifiers, diodes, and transistors; small signal analysis; energy and power. Time-and frequency-domain analysis of RLC circuits. Basic passive and active electronic filters. Laboratory experience with electrical signals and circuits.

coursework.title: Entrepreneurship Practicum
coursework.description: The Practicum immerses students in the entrepreneurial process in a supportive classroom environment. Students critically evaluate and then pursue the development of their own ideas for new ventures. Throughout the course, students work closely with entrepreneurship faculty and mentors.

coursework.title: Entrepreneurial Business Basics
coursework.description: This business basics course covers how to make a product or service idea real in the form of a tangible, marketable product and an organization that can produce and distribute it. Topic areas covered include: motivation and social purpose of entrepreneurship, market research and product development activities, people resource management, capital resources management, and go-to-market management.

coursework.title: Advanced Technical Communication for Computer Science
coursework.description: Advanced technical communication for computer science. Design and writing of user and task analyses, requirements documents, specifications, proposals, reports and documentation, all aimed at diverse organizational audiences. Preparation and delivery of final oral presentations and written project reports.

experience.title: Software Engineer
details: Design and prototype the embedded systems of a free-source internet-connected water purifier/analyzer
Build responsive web and mobile UIs using React to visualize data from water purifiers

experience.title: IT and Business Analytics Intern
details: Automated the remote deployment and installation of software updates and applications
Created interactive and business reports with Power BI and Microsoft Excel
Assisted in the programming, installation, and testing of network appliances

experience.title: Line Chef
details: Thrived in an extremely fast-paced kitchen; routinely handled a workload equal to ~10 hours within an 8-hour shift while keeping orders moving.
Prepared salads and side dishes to order
Handled dishwashing and closing tasks to support the kitchen.
Assisted with basic prep such as chopping, portioning, and labeling.

experience.title: Civil Engineering Intern
details: Utilized Sketchup and rendering software to create life-like 3D models of structures and terrain
Drafted and organized professional engineering documents for various civil projects
Provided duties of inspector throughout the construction of multiple housing developments to ensure abidance to local and national building codes and ordinances

experience.title: Survey Technician
details: Operated surveying equipment to map topographic and boundary surveys
Mentored new employees regarding proper equipment usage and survey strategy

experience.title: Line Chef
details: Prepared salads and side dishes to order and operated grill and fryer stations
Handled dishwashing and closing tasks to support the kitchen.
Assisted with basic prep such as chopping, portioning, and labeling.

extracurriculars.company: UofM's Bioastronautics & Life Support Systems Team
extracurriculars.title: Electrical Sub Team Lead
details: Led requirements, trade studies, verification, and risk for an ISS EXPRESS rack prototype
Coordinated with NASA stakeholders and cross-functional leads; mentored and delegated tasks
Integrated sensors, Raspberry Pi controllers, and power relays to actuate pumps/lights/heaters; bench-tested
Built React front end + Express.js back end with a peer-to-peer link to a control laptop; enabled CSV (comma-separated values) logging, manual control, and live video

extracurriculars.company: UofM's Bioastronautics & Life Support Systems Team
extracurriculars.title: Data Sub Team Member
details: Conducted trade studies, requirements decomposition, and verification planning for early-stage astronaut exercise equipment
Designed embedded firmware (Arduino), sensor integration (IÂ²C/UART), and a touchscreen GUI for real-time data acquisition, visualization, and logging

extracurriculars.title: Treasurer
details: Applied for grants and dispersed funds to selected startups and entrepreneurs based on campus
Interviewed established entrepreneurs to inquire lessons learned from their experiences
